import duckdb
from orchestrator_mvp.core.workforce_calculations import calculate_workforce_requirements_from_config
import yaml

# Connect to the database and check the baseline workforce
conn = duckdb.connect(''simulation.duckdb'')
result = conn.execute(''SELECT COUNT(*) FROM int_baseline_workforce WHERE employment_status = ""active""'').fetchone()
active_count = result[0]

print(''ðŸŽ‰ SUCCESS: MVP PIPELINE WORKING! ðŸŽ‰'')
print(''='' * 50)
print(f''âœ… int_baseline_workforce created: {active_count:,} active employees'')

# Load config and calculate requirements
with open(''config/test_config.yaml'', ''r'') as f:
    config = yaml.safe_load(f)

workforce_config = config[''workforce'']
workforce_config[''target_growth_rate''] = config[''ops''][''run_multi_year_simulation''][''config''][''target_growth_rate'']

calc_result = calculate_workforce_requirements_from_config(active_count, workforce_config)

print()
print(''ðŸ“Š NEXT YEAR SIMULATION REQUIREMENTS:'')
print(f''   â€¢ Starting workforce: {calc_result[""current_workforce""]:,}'')
print(f''   â€¢ Terminations needed: {calc_result[""experienced_terminations""]:,}'')
print(f''   â€¢ Gross hires needed: {calc_result[""total_hires_needed""]:,}'')
print(f''   â€¢ Expected new hire terminations: {calc_result[""expected_new_hire_terminations""]:,}'')
print(f''   â€¢ Net growth: +{calc_result[""net_hiring_impact""]:,}'')
print()
print(''âœ… Workforce calculation function working with real baseline data!'')
conn.close()

import duckdb

# Connect to the database and check what tables exist
conn = duckdb.connect(''simulation.duckdb'')
tables = conn.execute(''SHOW TABLES'').fetchall()
print(''Available tables:'')
for table in tables:
    print(f''  - {table[0]}'')

# Try with schema prefix
try:
    result = conn.execute(''SELECT COUNT(*) FROM main.int_baseline_workforce WHERE employment_status = ""active""'').fetchone()
    active_count = result[0]
    print(f''âœ… Found int_baseline_workforce: {active_count:,} active employees'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''âŒ Error: {e}'')

conn.close()

from orchestrator_mvp.core.database_manager import get_connection, list_tables
from orchestrator_mvp.core.workforce_calculations import calculate_workforce_requirements_from_config
import yaml

# Check what tables exist using the MVP orchestrator''s database manager
tables = list_tables()
print(''âœ… TABLES IN MVP DATABASE:'')
for table in tables:
    print(f''  - {table}'')

# Check for int_baseline_workforce specifically
if ''int_baseline_workforce'' in tables:
    conn = get_connection()
    try:
        result = conn.execute(''SELECT COUNT(*) FROM int_baseline_workforce WHERE employment_status = ""active""'').fetchone()
        active_count = result[0]
        print(f''\nðŸŽ‰ SUCCESS: int_baseline_workforce has {active_count:,} active employees'')
        
        # Load config and calculate workforce requirements
        with open(''config/test_config.yaml'', ''r'') as f:
            config = yaml.safe_load(f)
        
        workforce_config = config[''workforce'']
        workforce_config[''target_growth_rate''] = config[''ops''][''run_multi_year_simulation''][''config''][''target_growth_rate'']
        
        calc_result = calculate_workforce_requirements_from_config(active_count, workforce_config)
        
        print(''\nðŸ“Š NEXT YEAR SIMULATION REQUIREMENTS:'')
        print(f''   â€¢ Starting workforce: {calc_result[""current_workforce""]:,}'')
        print(f''   â€¢ Terminations needed: {calc_result[""experienced_terminations""]:,}'')
        print(f''   â€¢ Gross hires needed: {calc_result[""total_hires_needed""]:,}'')
        print(f''   â€¢ Expected new hire terminations: {calc_result[""expected_new_hire_terminations""]:,}'')
        print(f''   â€¢ Net growth: +{calc_result[""net_hiring_impact""]:,}'')
        print(''\nâœ… MVP WORKFORCE CALCULATION WORKING WITH REAL DATA!'')
        
    finally:
        conn.close()
else:
    print(''\nâŒ int_baseline_workforce table not found'')
")
